perturbation.original_text: 4.7. Invoice Terms. Sekisui shall pay for each Product sold by Qualigen within 30 days after Sekisui has received the applicable invoice from Qualigen.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.7. Invoice Terms. Sekisui shall pay for each Product sold by Qualigen within 60 days after Sekisui has received the applicable invoice from Qualigen.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct contradiction with Section 4.10, which states that interest accrues on payments more than 30 days past due. By extending the payment term to 60 days in Section 4.7, it becomes unclear when late fees apply, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 4.10. Interest. Accrual and payment of interest shall not be deemed to excuse or cure breaches of contract arising from late payment or nonpayment. Cumulative with and not exclusive of any and all other available remedies, payments that are more than 30 days past due hereunder, and which are not otherwise subject to a good faith dispute, shall accrue interest, from the due date until paid, at an annual rate equal to the prime rate, as reported in The Wall Street Journal, Eastern U.S. Edition, on the date such payment is due, plus an additional 200 basis points (2%).
perturbation.changed_text: 4.10. Interest. Accrual and payment of interest shall not be deemed to excuse or cure breaches of contract arising from late payment or nonpayment. Cumulative with and not exclusive of any and all other available remedies, payments that are more than 90 days past due hereunder, and which are not otherwise subject to a good faith dispute, shall accrue interest, from the due date until paid, at an annual rate equal to the prime rate, as reported in The Wall Street Journal, Eastern U.S. Edition, on the date such payment is due, plus an additional 200 basis points (2%).
perturbation.explanation: This modification creates a contradictory deadline for late payment interest accrual. Section 4.7 states payment is due in 60 days, but Section 4.10 now indicates interest applies after 90 days. This inconsistency introduces ambiguity concerning the enforcement of interest charges on late payments.

perturbation.original_text: 15.5. Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given and made (i) if by personal delivery, on the date of such delivery, (ii) if by recognized overnight courier specifying next-business-day delivery, on the next business day after the date of deposit with such courier (by the courier's stated time for enabling next-business-day delivery), (iii) if by email, on the date sent by email if sent during normal business hours of the recipient, and on the next business day if sent after normal business hours of the recipient, and (iv) if by US registered mail, on the fifth business day following such mailing in the US, in each case addressed at the address shown below for, or such other address as may be designated by 10 days' advance written notice hereunder by, such Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.5. Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given and made (i) if by personal delivery, on the date of such delivery, (ii) if by recognized overnight courier specifying next-business-day delivery, on the next business day after the date of deposit with such courier (by the courier's stated time for enabling next-business-day delivery), (iii) if by email, on the date sent by email if sent during normal business hours of the recipient, and on the next business day if sent after normal business hours of the recipient, and (iv) if by US registered mail, on the tenth business day following such mailing in the US, in each case addressed at the address shown below for, or such other address as may be designated by 5 days' advance written notice hereunder by, such Party.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces two conflicting deadlines related to legal notices. Originally, registered mail notices are deemed delivered after 5 business days, and address changes require a 10-day notice. The modified text extends the mail delivery time to 10 days but shortens the address change notice to 5 days. This inconsistency creates uncertainty regarding which timeframe to follow, potentially invalidating legal notices and impacting dispute resolution.
